title: Present Perfect Continuous
description: Слушайте действия, которые начались в прошлом и продолжаются сейчас.

tasks.audioText: Look at Mark — he's completely exhausted. He has been running for over an hour.
tasks.transcript: He has been running for over an hour.

options.text: He started running more than an hour ago and just stopped.
He ran for exactly one hour yesterday.
He is about to start running soon.
He runs every hour as part of his routine.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been running for over an hour' means the action started more than an hour ago and has just finished or is still happening.

tasks.audioText: The kitchen is a mess. My sister has been baking cakes since morning.
tasks.transcript: My sister has been baking cakes since morning.

options.text: She baked one cake this morning.
She started baking in the morning and is still baking now.
She will bake cakes tomorrow morning.
She finished baking before morning.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been baking since morning' means the action started in the morning and continues up to now.

tasks.audioText: Why are your eyes so red? I have been studying all night for my exam.
tasks.transcript: I have been studying all night for my exam.

options.text: I studied for a short time last night.
I plan to study tonight for my exam.
I spent the entire night studying and it shows.
I always study at night before exams.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been studying all night' shows a long continuous action with a visible result — red eyes.

tasks.audioText: The ground is very wet outside. It has been raining since yesterday evening.
tasks.transcript: It has been raining since yesterday evening.

options.text: It rained only yesterday evening and stopped.
It will rain starting this evening.
The rain started yesterday evening and continues now.
It rained for a few minutes yesterday.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been raining since yesterday evening' means rain started then and is still falling now.

tasks.audioText: Tom looks very tired today. He has been working overtime for three weeks.
tasks.transcript: He has been working overtime for three weeks.

options.text: He worked extra hours during the past three weeks and still does.
He worked overtime only once, three weeks ago.
He will start working overtime in three weeks.
He stopped working three weeks ago.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been working overtime for three weeks' shows a continuous action over a period that is still relevant.

tasks.audioText: Sarah is very good at Japanese now. She has been learning it for two years.
tasks.transcript: She has been learning it for two years.

options.text: She learned Japanese two years ago and stopped.
She will begin learning Japanese in two years.
She started learning Japanese two years ago and still learns it.
She studied Japanese for only two months.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been learning for two years' means the learning started two years ago and continues now.

tasks.audioText: I called you several times. I have been trying to reach you since lunchtime.
tasks.transcript: I have been trying to reach you since lunchtime.

options.text: I tried to call you once at lunch.
I have been making repeated attempts to contact you from lunchtime until now.
I will try to reach you after lunch.
You have been trying to reach me since lunch.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been trying since lunchtime' means repeated ongoing attempts from lunchtime to the present.

tasks.audioText: The children are covered in paint. They have been painting pictures all afternoon.
tasks.transcript: They have been painting pictures all afternoon.

options.text: They painted one picture quickly this afternoon.
They spent the whole afternoon painting and it is visible.
They will paint pictures tomorrow afternoon.
They finished painting before the afternoon.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been painting all afternoon' describes a continuous activity throughout the afternoon with visible evidence.

tasks.audioText: My neighbour is really annoyed. Someone has been playing loud music for hours.
tasks.transcript: Someone has been playing loud music for hours.

options.text: Someone played music for a few minutes and stopped.
Nobody has been playing any music.
Someone will play loud music later tonight.
Loud music has been going on for a long time and has not stopped.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been playing for hours' indicates a continuous annoying action lasting many hours up to now.

tasks.audioText: Doctor, I feel terrible. I have been coughing for five days now.
tasks.transcript: I have been coughing for five days now.

options.text: I coughed once five days ago.
My cough started five days ago and I still have it.
I will probably start coughing in five days.
I had a cough but it went away five days ago.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been coughing for five days' means the coughing started five days ago and is still happening.

tasks.audioText: We can see a lot of progress on the building. They have been constructing it since January.
tasks.transcript: They have been constructing it since January.

options.text: They built the whole thing in January.
Construction will begin next January.
The construction started in January and is still in progress.
They stopped constructing the building in January.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been constructing since January' means work began in January and continues to the present.

tasks.audioText: You smell like smoke. Have you been smoking again?

options.text: Will you smoke in the future?
Did you smoke a long time ago?
The speaker asks if the person has recently been smoking.
The speaker offers the person a cigarette.

tasks.explanation: 'Have you been smoking' is a question about a recent continuous action with visible evidence — the smell.

tasks.audioText: Lisa speaks English almost fluently now. She has been practising every day for six months.
tasks.transcript: She has been practising every day for six months.

options.text: She practised only once six months ago.
She has had daily practice over the last six months.
She will start practising in six months.
She stopped practising six months ago.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been practising every day for six months' means regular ongoing practice over a six-month period up to now.

tasks.audioText: I'm sorry I'm late to the meeting. I have been waiting for the bus for forty minutes.
tasks.transcript: I have been waiting for the bus for forty minutes.

options.text: I waited for the bus for only five minutes.
I took a taxi instead of the bus.
The bus wait lasted forty minutes, which made me late.
I have been driving my car for forty minutes.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been waiting for forty minutes' shows a long continuous wait that caused the delay.

tasks.audioText: The project is almost done. Our team has been developing this app since last summer.
tasks.transcript: Our team has been developing this app since last summer.

options.text: The team developed the app in one day last summer.
The team will start developing the app next summer.
The team finished the app last summer.
Development started last summer and has been ongoing until now.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been developing since last summer' means work began last summer and continues to the present.

short_description: Действия от прошлого до настоящего: have/has been + verb-ing
